title: Resigning Gracefully
description: Leaving a job is a significant career move. How you resign can impact your professional reputation and future opportunities. The goal is to leave on positive terms.
sentences: Always inform your direct manager first, in a private, face-to-face meeting if possible.
Follow up with a formal, polite, and concise resignation letter.
Your notice period is a legal and professional obligation; serve it diligently.
Create a detailed handover document to ensure a smooth transition for your team and replacement.
Prepare for the exit interview; provide constructive feedback professionally.
dos: Express gratitude for the opportunity and experiences.
Offer to help train your replacement.
Stay positive and focused on your work during the notice period.
Connect with colleagues on LinkedIn to maintain your professional network.
donts: Don't resign impulsively or in a moment of anger.
Don't badmouth your boss, colleagues, or the company.
Don't slack off or become unproductive after you've resigned.
Don't brag about your new job to your current colleagues.
